TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void AuthenticateEventHandler(object sender, AuthenticateEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed AuthenticateEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub AuthenticateEventHandler(sender As Object, e As AuthenticateEventArgs)
public delegate void AuthenticateEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, AuthenticateEventArgs ^ e);
type AuthenticateEventHandler = delegate of obj * AuthenticateEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: An that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you create an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AuthenticateEventHandler> delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event handler delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](/dotnet/standard/events/).
